title: Project Firefly by Adobe
description: This documentation provides an overview of Project Firefly as well as guides, reference documentation, and tools to help you begin developing your own custom applications

title: Adobe I/O Auth Developer Guide
description: This guide contains all you need to know to authenticate your apps with Adobe services

title: Adobe I/O Console Developer Guide
description: Adobe I/O Events enables building reactive, event-driven applications, based on events originating from various Adobe services

title: Adobe I/O Events Developer Guide
description: This documentation provides an overview of Adobe I/O Runtime as well as guides, reference documentation, and tools to help you begin developing your own integrations

title: Adobe I/O Runtime Developer Guide
description: This documentation provides an overview of Adobe I/O Events as well as guides, reference documentation, and tools to help you begin developing your own integrations

title: Adobe I/O CLI
description: Extensible CLI with all-batteries-included tools for building apps

title: Adobe I/O SDK
description: Module that contains all the Adobe I/O SDKs

title: Adobe I/O Core SDK
description: Module that contains all the Adobe I/O Core SDKs

title: Adobe Spectrum Design System
description: Spectrum provides components and tools to help product teams work more efficiently, and to make Adobe’s applications more cohesive

title: Adobe Spectrum CSS
description: Spectrum CSS is an open-source implementation of Spectrum, Adobe’s design system. It includes components and resources to make applications more cohesive

author: Duy Nguyen
title: How to Build an Adobe I/O CodeLab
description: In this lab you will learn how to create a new codelab from the template repository, develop the content locally as well as publish it to the Adobe I/O CodeLabs website.

author: Holly Schinsky
title: AI Compositions powered by Adobe Sensei and Adobe I/O Runtime
description: In this lab you will learn how to build a serverless app that takes advantage of Adobe’s cloud offerings, Adobe I/O developer tools and APIs and Adobe Sensei functions.

author: Sarah Xu
title: Adobe I/O Lab Workbook - The FaaSt path to Beautiful Applications
description: In this lab, you will learn what is Adobe I/O Runtime and serverless computing, how to create your own Runtime serverless integration with I/O Console and Adobe CLI, best practice for serverless development, using serverless development in event-driven Experience Cloud Use Cases

title: ACS AEM Commons - Adobe I/O APIs
description: Enables to make Adobe I/O api-calls in AEM whereby all the plumbing is done for you.

author: Justin Edelson
title: Adobe Cloud Manager I/O Runtime Deployer
description: This project contains actions for Adobe I/O Runtime which allow for other Runtime actions to be deployed in coordination with a CI/CD pipeline executed by Adobe Cloud Manager. While these actions are fully functional, they are intended primarily for use as a reference point for users of Cloud Manager and I/O Runtime as a basis for their own actions.

author: Stephan Ringel
title: CNA Barcode Generator
description: A Barcode Generator built as a Cloud Native App (CNA)
